intro: Palicourea tamaensis var. psilophylla, commonly known as the small-leaf palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly in countries like Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are usually arranged oppositely along the stems. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The species is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
